Project Portfolio

Technetium

JavaScript • Python • Django • D3 • Bitbucket API

A Bitbucket data aggregation tool built using Bitbucket's RESTful API. Features a centralized issue tracker, repository subscription manager, and reports/graphs which enumerate the commit/issue activity of each user in a subscribed repository.

Technetium's frontend is build using Twitter Bootstrap. The centralized issue tracker gathers data through Bitbucket's API endpoints, and is sped up considerably using Python's gevents library for sending asynchronous requests, while being highly responsive using AJAX to load/filter issue data.

Live Demo | Read More


Smarthouse For Everyone

JavaScript • NodeJS • Arduino • iOS • C • Django • Python

A plug-an-play device for remote control of anything that is plugged into it. The motiviation behind this project is to allow home automation for the visually impaired and physically challenged.

Features:

  • Custom Node.JS RESTful API
  • Custom Hardware build on top of an Arduino Mega
  • iOS Application with gesture recognition and voice control

Super Mario World - Koopa Krisis

ImpactJS • JavaScript • HTML5

A Super Mario World Clone built using JavaScript on top of the ImpactJS game engine, purely for educational purposes.

Features:

  • Powerup System
  • Collectable Items
  • Custom Overworld
  • Over 10 custom levels
  • Over 28 custom enemies with different Artificial Intelligences
  • Custom boss with increasingly difficult Artificial Intelligence

Live Demo | Source Code

El-Gamal Attack

Cryptography • Python

A Python project with explores the semantic secureness of pycrypto's implementation of El Gamal. Using the Chinese Remainder Theorem, we can determine that some of the information of a transmitted message M is leaked. This information is efficiently computable by an adversary, showing that pycrypo's El Gamal implementation is not semantically secure.

New personal web page of David Leonard. Engineer, Programmer and Enthusiast.
